div.p: DIV2 (i.e. level-2 text division) is an element that marks the third largest structural division in all types of textbase documents.

In WRITING sections of entries, make sure that the DIV2 level contains all of the PRODUCTION, TEXTUALFEATURES, or RECEPTION elements which refer to the text or texts under consideration here (often named in a TEXTSCOPE for the DIV2 level). Place HEADINGs immediately inside the DIV2 element, and they will display as Sub-headings. Place TEXTSCOPEs to follow the HEADING, or the DIV2 element. In BIOGRAPHY sections, DIV2s go inside big-bucket tags (BIRTH, CULTURALFORMATION, etc.); in WRITING sections they enclose such tags. Each DIV2 element should normally not contain more than one publication event unless extra ones record serialization or later editions or reissues of the central one. TEXTSCOPEs should be entered after DIV2 tags (and after a HEADING tag if there is one rendered as a sub-heading) and NOT after DIV1 tags.
